science after having heard the album at

had me hooked from the start
I loved the overly abstract narratives
and the cold electronics just had me

in 1982 and this is Laurie Anderson's
first album in 10 years and this is
pretty much about as cinematic as any
album is going to get this year it's not
really a release that you listen to
simply for its music though it is
musical there's really more to it than
that the poetry of Laurie's words and
sometimes the lack of sound in a given
track can mean everything to me that's
kind of classic Laurie Anderson because
from big science to bright red
to here there's always been this
prevalent desolation to the sound set of
her music at least some of her music but
going back to the words the poetry the
verbage I can't help but hang on this
woman's every word and on homeland she
points out America's faults politically
and philosophically without subjecting
listeners to an overly preachy solution
to the problem instead she keeps things
simple and yet so complicated because to
tell you the truth I have no clue what
this woman is trying to say at least
half the time
not that it's gibberish but a single one
of her sentences could be interpreted in
about a dozen different ways usually I
just find myself trying to find the most
appropriate way to react to one of
Laurie Anderson's songs on this album
for example my favorite track is the 11
minute another day in America and it's
this very long drawn-out narrative and
she tells a story in it a short story in
it because there are a lot of different
passages to this narrative and this
story is about a couple who gets a
divorce and they hate each other and
they wait until their 90s to get
divorced and when asked why did you wait
so long to get the divorce the responses
well we wanted to wait until the
children died now my initial reaction to
that to the story the story itself is to
laugh because that's a funny story
that's a joke however there's a load of
social critique in that because some
people do live like that that is an
extreme but a lot of people you know oh
we stayed married because we wanted to
wait until the kids moved out of the
house and then you have this third level
where you have this story which is funny

lower
is reading off this story in a very

pulling from different emotional sides

confused I'm upset
